resources.string:
The handstand push-up (press-up) - also
called the vertical push-up (press-up) or the
inverted push-up (press-up) also called
"commandos"-is a type of push-up exercise
where the body is positioned in a handstand.
To prepare the strenght until one has built
adequate balance.

Push up is a type of strength exercises that work to strengthen the biceps and triceps . Early position on his stomach with his hands on the right side of the body. Then the body is pushed upward by hand force. The position of the feet and body remains straight or upright. After that, the body is lowered while maintaining the condition of the body and legs remain straight.

A dip is an upper-body strength exercise. Narrow, shoulder-width dips primarily train the triceps, with major synergists being the anterior deltoid, the pectoralis muscles (sternal, clavicular, and minor), and the rhomboid muscles of the back (in that order).[1] Wide arm training places additional emphasis on the pectoral muscles, similar in respect to the way a wide grip bench press would focus more on the pectorals and less on the triceps
